thread.title: From the Expat Blog: How a Global Nomad Stays in Touch With Family and Friends
thread.title_full: From the Expat Blog: How a Global Nomad Stays in Touch With Family and Friends - WSJ

author: Jin Kim
title: From the Expat Blog: How a Global Nomad Stays in Touch With Family and Friends
text:
I enjoy living in New York, but I am the only member of my immediate family in the U.S. and I left friends behind in several countries when I moved here. As I have bounced around from South Korea to Chile to Nicaragua and then to the U.S. for more than 15 years, staying in touch with loved ones has required planning and effort.
Time difference is one of the biggest logistical hurdles. My sister lives in South Korea, 13 hours ahead of me, but she never seems to remember this fact when sending me a string of instant... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
